args: Hello there, Bella. It's been a while.\nSorry to barge in like this during practice.

Karina? Oh, but it HAS been a while!
Thank you again for your help with that
whole ＂phantom thief＂ situation.
So then, what brings you here today?
I was wondering if you'd let me sticky-\nfinger some of the scripts for the operas\nyou've performed in.
In particular, I'm looking for ones where\nthe cast isn't all nobles. Farmers, laborers,\ntavernkeeps... You know. Salt of the earth.
Yes, I've done a few operas in that vein.\nWhat has you searching for such a thing,\nif I might ask?
I'm trying to have my pirate crew put on\nan opera, and I need to find one that\nsuits their particular...vibe.
Oh my! A pirate opera certainly sounds\nlike a delightful bit of fun!
Wait, really? I figured you'd go off about\nhow it was a terrible idea that will never\nwork in a gazillion years.
Nothing is impossible in this world.
＂No escape?＂ Do you understand\nto whom you are speaking?
I am the phantom thief, she who makes\nthe impossible possible!
(Am I imagining things here, or is Bella\nactually pretty similar to Lapis?)
I'm happy to pick out some scripts for you.\nJust give me a little bit, all right?
...Okay, so she's like Lapis. So what?\nFocus, Karina! Time to check on the crew!
I know she'll be able to find something\nthat suits my crew perfectly!
All right, you lot! What have you been\nup to while I...was...out...?
Gahaaar har har! Yer puttin' me in stitches!
And I can't be helpin' it! This sea dog here\nlaughs at all me jokes fit to split!
No need to apologize. I told you all to\nrelax for a bit, and that's clearly what\nyou've been doing.
Aye, we're fresh as a swabbed deck!
Good. Don't want you overdoing it on the\npractice and singing yourselves hoarse.
...Er, by the way, what's up with him?
What's with your voice?! It's all raspy!
S-sorry, cap'n... I broke your rules and\npracticed all night... *cough*
I should have seen this coming.
(He's got a lot of pride, that one.\nLoves nothing better than showing off.)
Well, no use crying about milk spilt\noverboard, I suppose.

All right, you tars, listen up! I've brought
a mountain of scripts back with me,
so I want to you read them SILENTLY
so you can rest your voices! Got it?!
All right, the scripts are all read.\nLet's get to this, sea dogs!
(No prideful aristocrats in this one,\nplus a humorous show would probably\ngo over great with normal folks.)

You cut my lovely hair,
but now my bowl cut's square!
I'll not pay you a cent,
so you can go get bent! ♪
(Plus, he's a funny guy who likes to make\npeople laugh, so he's great for the lead.)
No no, my friend! That will not do!\nI must have my due for your new 'do! ♪
(Great! She's friendly and charming,\nso she's great for a role that calls for\ninnocently throwing things off-track.)
You messed up his hair. That isn't fair. \nNow he won't look...uh...debonaire. ♪
(Uh oh. He's prideful and wants to be cool,\nso the idea of being laughed at is making\nhis performance a little wooden.)
All right, I've seen enough!\nLet's try the next one.
(So in this one, the lead is a bandit.)

There's no chest I can't crack!
No loot I can't steal!
So stay out of me way,
or you'll taste me steel! ♪
(Oh, he's perfect for the role of a\nclever bandit leader!)
There's no trap that works on me...\nNow face the wrath of my machete! ♪
(Ha ha! This is a lively role and he's\njust KILLING it!)
My lovely face...\nIs all style and grace...\nBut look too long and you get the mace! ♪
(Yeaaaah, I think she's a bit too...blunt\nto play a femme fatale bandit.)
...But hard as they tried, they couldn't find a script\namong the lot that worked for the entire crew.
Yar, sorry, Cap'n. This all be on account\nof our poor actin' chops, by gar.
Belay that talk, sailor! I'll find something\nthat works—I just need a little more time.
We've got to shore up your foundations,\nso for now, just work on voice exercises.
...Phew! I know I told them it's fine,\nbut I really am adrift without an oar here.
If worst comes to worst, I suppose one of\nthem may just have to be sort of...bad?
No! What am I thinking?! That will just put\nthe crowd to sleep—or lead to a hail of\ntomatoes, which I do NOT want to clean.

Plus, the person who ends up in the role
that doesn't suit them gets the short end
of the plank. I could never do something
like that to my sea family!
The big ham who doesn't sweat\nthe details...
We've got all sorts, and they're free to\nact in a way that suits them—THAT'S\nwhat this pirate band is all about!
Hell, we've always been a pack of misfits.\nI wasn't even sure we'd be able to work\ntogether at first...
Heh. This takes me back. We've had\nsome pretty crazy adventures over\nthe years...
Well, keelhaul me booty... That's IT!
